verses.verse: But it happened after<WH3117> a while,<WH3117> in the time of wheat<WH2406> harvest,<WH7105> that Samson<WH8123> visited<WH6485> his wife<WH802> with a young goat;<WH1423> and he said,<WH559> "I will go in<WH935> to my wife<WH802> into the room.<WH2315>" But her father<WH1> wouldn't<WH5414> allow him to go in.<WH935>

Her father<WH1> said,<WH559> "I most certainly<WH559> thought<WH559> that you had utterly<WH8130> hated<WH8130> her;<WH5414> therefore I gave her to your companion.<WH4828> Isn't<WH6996> her younger sister<WH269> more beautiful than she?<WH2896> Please take her, instead."
Samson<WH8123> said<WH559> to them,<WH6471> "This time I will be blameless<WH5352> in regard of the Philistines,<WH6430> when<WH6213> I harm them.<WH7451>"

Samson<WH8123> went<WH3212> and caught<WH3920> three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967> foxes,<WH7776> and took<WH3947> torches,<WH3940> and turned<WH6437> tail<WH2180> to tail,<WH2180> and put<WH7760> a<WH259> torch<WH3940> in the midst<WH8432> between every two<WH8147> tails.<WH2180>

When he had set<WH1197> the brands<WH3940> on fire,<WH784> he let them go<WH7971> into the standing grain<WH7054> of the Philistines,<WH6430> and burnt up<WH1197> both the shocks<WH1430> and the standing grain,<WH7054> and also the olive groves.<WH2132>

Then the Philistines<WH6430> said,<WH559> "Who has done<WH6213> this?<WH559>" They said, "Samson,<WH8123> the son-in<WH2860>-law of the Timnite,<WH8554> because he has taken<WH3947> his wife,<WH802> and given<WH5414> her to his companion.<WH4828>" The Philistines<WH6430> came up,<WH5927> and burnt<WH8313> her and her father<WH1> with fire.<WH784>
Samson<WH8123> said<WH559> to them,<WH518> "If you behave<WH6213> like this,<WH2063> surely I will be avenged<WH5358> of you,<WH310> and after that I will cease.<WH2308>"

He struck<WH5221> them hip<WH7785> and<WH5921> thigh<WH3409> with a great<WH1419> slaughter:<WH4347> and he went down<WH3381> and lived<WH3427> in the cleft<WH5585> of the rock<WH5553> of Etam.<WH5862>
Then the Philistines<WH6430> went up,<WH5927> and encamped<WH2583> in Judah,<WH3063> and spread<WH5203> themselves in Lehi.<WH3896>

The men<WH376> of Judah<WH3063> said,<WH559> "Why have you come up<WH5927> against us?<WH559>" They said, "We have come up<WH5927> to bind<WH631> Samson,<WH8123> to do<WH6213> to him as he has done to us.<WH6213>"

Then three<WH7969> thousand<WH505> men<WH376> of Judah<WH3063> went<WH3381> down to the cleft<WH5585> of the rock<WH5553> of Etam,<WH5862> and said<WH559> to Samson,<WH8123> "Don't<WH3045> you know that the Philistines<WH6430> are rulers<WH4910> over us?<WH6213> What then is this that you have done to us?<WH559>" He said to them,<WH6213> "As they did to me,<WH6213> so have I done to them."

They said<WH559> to him,<WH3381> "We have come down to bind<WH631> you,<WH5414> that we may deliver you into the hand<WH3027> of the Philistines.<WH6430>" Samson<WH8123> said<WH559> to them,<WH7650> "Swear to me that you will not fall on me yourselves.<WH6293>"

They spoke<WH559> to him,<WH559> saying, "No;<WH631> but we will bind you fast,<WH631> and deliver<WH5414> you into their hand;<WH3027> but surely<WH4191> we will not kill<WH4191> you.<WH631>" They bound him with two<WH8147> new<WH2319> ropes,<WH5688> and brought him up<WH5927> from the rock.<WH5553>

When he came<WH935> to Lehi,<WH3896> the Philistines<WH6430> shouted<WH7321> as<WH7125> they met him:<WH7307> and the Spirit of Yahweh<WH3068> came mightily<WH6743> on him,<WH5688> and the ropes that were on his arms<WH2220> became as flax<WH6593> that was burnt<WH1197> with fire,<WH784> and his bands<WH612> dropped<WH4549> from off his hands.<WH3027>
He found<WH4672> a fresh<WH2961> jawbone<WH3895> of a donkey,<WH2543> and put forth<WH7971> his hand,<WH3027> and took<WH3947> it,<WH5221> and struck a thousand<WH505> men therewith.<WH376>

Samson<WH8123> said,<WH559> "With the jawbone<WH3895> of a donkey,<WH2543> heaps<WH2565> on heaps;<WH2565> with the jawbone<WH3895> of a donkey<WH2543> I have struck<WH5221> a thousand<WH505> men.<WH376>"
It happened,<WH3615> when he had made an end of speaking,<WH1696> that he cast away<WH7993> the jawbone<WH3895> out of his hand;<WH3027> and that place<WH4725> was called<WH7121> Ramath Lehi.<WH7437>

He was very<WH3966> thirsty,<WH6770> and called<WH7121> on Yahweh,<WH3068> and said,<WH559> "You have given<WH5414> this great<WH1419> deliverance<WH8668> by the hand<WH3027> of your servant;<WH5650> and now shall I die<WH4191> for thirst,<WH6772> and fall<WH5307> into the hand<WH3027> of the uncircumcised?<WH6189>"

But God<WH430> split<WH1234> the hollow place<WH4388> that is in Lehi,<WH3895> and water<WH4325> came<WH3318> out of it.<WH8354> When he had drunk, his spirit<WH7307> came again,<WH7725> and he revived:<WH2421> therefore its name<WH8034> was called<WH7121> En Hakkore,<WH5875> which is in Lehi,<WH3896> to this day.<WH3117>
He judged<WH8199> Israel<WH3478> in the days<WH3117> of the Philistines<WH6430> twenty<WH6242> years.<WH8141>
